yielding|inclined to yield to argument or influence or control - "a timid yielding person";lacking stiffness and giving way to pressure - "a deep yielding layer of foam rubber";tending to give in or surrender or agree - "too yielding to make a stand against any encroachments"- V.I.Parrington
yogistic|of or relating to yoga
yokel-like|stupid and ignorant like proverbial rural inhabitants - "the boy's empty yokel-like expression"
yonder|distant but within sight ('yon' is dialectal) - "yonder valley" - "the hills yonder"
young|(used of living things especially persons) in an early period of life or development or growth - "young people";being in its early stage - "a young industry" - "the day is still young"
young-begetting|capable of fathering offspring
younger|used of the younger of two persons of the same name especially used to distinguish a son from his father
youngish|somewhat young
youthful|suggestive of youth;vigorous and fresh
Y-shaped|shaped in the form of the letter Y
Yugoslavian|of or relating to or characteristic of the former country of Yugoslavia or its people or languages - "Yugoslavian wine"
Yuman|of or relating to the language or culture of the Yuma people
Zairean|of or relating to or characteristic of Zaire or its people - "Zairean elections"
Zambian|of or relating to or characteristic of Zambia or its people
Zapotec|of or relating to the language or culture of the Zapotec people
zenithal|relating to or located at or near the zenith
zero|having no measurable or otherwise determinable value - "the goal is zero population growth";indicating an initial point or origin;indicating the absence of any or all units under consideration - "a zero score";of or relating to the null set (a set with no members)
zeroth|preceding even the first
zestful|marked by spirited enjoyment
zigzag|having short sharp turns or angles
zillion|very large indeterminate number - "a zillion people were there"
Zimbabwean|of or relating to or characteristic of Zimbabwe or its people
Zionist|relating to or characteristic of a supporter of Zionism - "the Zionist leader Theodor Herzl";relating to or characteristic of Zionism - "the Zionist movement"
zodiacal|relating to or included in the zodiac - "zodiacal constellations"
zoic|pertaining to animals or animal life or action
Zolaesque|in the manner of Emile Zola
zonal|associated with or divided into zones - "a zonal pattern of cell structure" - "zonal division";relating to or of the nature of a zone - "the zonal frontier"
zoological|concerning the study of animals and their classification and properties - "zoological research";of or relating to animals or animal groups - "zoological garden"
zoonotic|of or relating to or constituting zoonosis - "the Ebola virus is believed to be zoonotic"
Zoroastrian|of or pertaining to Zoroaster or the religion he founded
zygodactyl|(of bird feet) having the first and fourth toes directed backward the second and third forward
zygomatic|of or relating to the cheek region of the face
zygomorphic|capable of division into symmetrical halves by only one longitudinal plane passing through the axis
zygotic|of or relating to a zygote
zymoid|resembling an enzyme
zymotic|of or relating to or causing fermentation;relating to or caused by infection
